> the wrong column:

> 500/Internal Server Error
> 400/Bad Request

Hello,
No they are not.
You're not correctly reading report.
It provides for each sample (first column) the TOP5 errors for it in next columns.
So each column can contain any type of errors.

Regards


> ---
> 
> I will also suggested a improvement to the table (as I found it a confusing)
> with title:
> 
> "Report / Dashboard : Top 5 Errors by sampler - Improving table structure"

creator: alexander.barker@interactivedata.com
text:
Hi,

If im reading/understanding it wrong then there is a problem.

In my eyes it should be easy to understand and we should not expect the user to sit there scratching his head wondering what the table is trying to show me.

I assume you mean the "first row" and not "first column". If this is the case then, there should be a clear separator between the first row and the following rows as one (like myself) would assume that they are summaries of the columns below. But they are not. 

e.g. Look at the "Statistics" table above. The totals row (first row) are totals of the columns below them. In the table "Top 5 Errors by sampler" this is obviously not the case as you kindly mentioned.

I now understand how this table works. However, to make it more understandable I would suggest the following:

1. Remove the 1st row of the table "Top 5 Errors by sampler" named "Total" as this shows exactly the same as the table above it.

2. Add the "total" row to the top of the table "Errors"

See screenshot

creator: alexander.barker@interactivedata.com
text:
Created attachment 34857
Move the totals row to the errors table to avoid confusion/cleaner dashboard.
